content.description:
Sustained climbing with a crux at the bulge half way through the climb.

 Heel hook the starting ledge (or don't) and move through balancy ledges and sidepulls. At the second bolt, trend left to a small, juggy horn and work up to an awesome stance for the third bolt clip. Use tiny hands and tiny feet to reach over the mini-roof onto giant jugs (another great clipping stance). Pull the roof using small, positive crimps, then finish up on easier, low-angled terrain to the anchors. Sustained fun the whole way!Â
content.location: Far right side of the Tool Buttress.
The far left side of the Tool Buttress.

content.description: From the Fixed Pin guide book:   A brilliant pitch that's just slightly easier than "Don't be a Tool". Climb through a series of big holds and small ledges to the bulging crux. Engineer a successful sequence and ride over sustained ground to the ledge. Take a much need break and then hop back on board for one more challenging move at the roof.
content.location: Bolt line to the left of "Don't be a Tool".

content.description: Starts on the left side of the arete with a small crux above the first bolt. Cross to the right side of the arete and continue up.
content.protection: 9 bolts. 2 bolt anchor. All guide books are wrong, there are 9 bolts on this route.
content.location: Walk up the stairs from When Panties Fly on the Tool Buttress. The arete across from the tool buttress.

content.description: Moderate climbing to positive holds and a ledge with a reach to a bolt just above the roof.
content.location: Walk up the stairs from When Panties Fly on the Tool Buttress. It is on the rock on the right side of the stairs facing the Tool Buttress.

content.description: Thin dihedral crack behind the tool buttress. Take the crack up to a ledge under the roof then over to easier climbing above.
Steep crimping leads to a rest right before a big move/dyno for the crux then on to somewhat sustained climbing upto and over a roof section. Gets kind of airy for a sport route which adds to the fun
content.location: This is the middle route on Tool Buttress

content.description: Well defined crux and sustained climbing throughout.
content.location: Right of Don't Be A Tool, last route (rightmost) with anchors over the roof.

content.description: The 3 sport climbs here are seldom visited. They are quality though so check them out. This area is sunny so it is best to avoid it in the summer. Lots of bouldering around here too. There are also 2 more roped climbs south of Tool Buttress. You basically will have to follow the bluff line and look for the anchors on these if you want to find them (5.7 and 5.9).
